code:
defmodule Solution do
  @spec minimum_right_shifts(nums :: [integer]) :: integer
  def minimum_right_shifts(nums) do
    # Check if the array is already sorted
    if Enum.sort(nums) == nums do
      0
    else
      find_shifts(nums)
    end
  end

  defp find_shifts(nums) do
    nums
    |> Enum.with_index()
    |> Enum.reduce_while({-1, 0}, fn {num, idx}, {prev_num, acc} ->
      if prev_num > num do
        {:halt, idx}
      else
        {:cont, {num, acc + 1}}
      end
    end)
    |> case do
      -1 -> -1
      index -> if valid_shift?(nums, index), do: Enum.count(nums) - index, else: -1
    end
  end

  defp valid_shift?(nums, index) do
    part1 = Enum.slice(nums, 0, index)
    part2 = Enum.slice(nums, index, Enum.count(nums) - index)
    part1 == Enum.sort(part1) and part2 == Enum.sort(part2) and hd(part2) < hd(Enum.reverse(part1))
  end
end
